items.title: 30-Minute Reserve Service
items.summary: Can be satisfied by online or offline resources that are able to respond in 30 minutes or less.

items.title: Adequacy
items.summary: The ability to supply the demand and energy requirements of the end-use customers.

items.title: Ambient-Adjusted Ratings
items.summary: A transmission facility rating.

items.title: Ancillary Services
items.summary: Services necessary to support the transmission of electric power.

items.title: Area Control Error
items.summary: ACE. The instantaneous difference between net actual and scheduled interchange.

items.title: Automatic Generation Control
items.summary: AGC. Automatic regulation of the power output of generators.

items.title: Autonomous
items.summary: A dynamic system's property.

items.title: Balancing Authority Area
items.summary: The collection of generation, transmission, and loads within the metered boundaries of the Balancing Authority.

items.title: Balancing Authority
items.summary: The responsible entity within a Balancing Authority Area.

items.title: Bilateral Transaction
items.summary: A direct contract between a seller and buyer outside of a centralized market.

items.title: Black Start
items.summary: Establishing the voltage from around zero

items.title: Bulk Electric System
items.summary: BES. Transmission Elements and Power resources 100 kV or higher.

items.title: Bulk Power System
items.summary: BPS. Facilities and control systems for an transmission network.

items.title: Capacity Markets
items.summary: A market for trading capacity credits.

items.title: Cascading Outage
items.summary: A sequence of events in which an initial disturbance triggers dependent component outages.

items.title: Cascading
items.summary: The uncontrolled successive loss of System Elements triggered by an incident.

items.title: Co-Located Load
items.summary: Load connected to the an existing or planned facility.

items.title: Common Format for Event Data Exchange
items.summary: COMFEDE. Inactive.

items.title: Common Format for Exchange of Solved Load Flow Data
items.summary: Data format

items.title: Common Format for Transient Data Exchange
items.summary: COMTRADE. Inactive.

items.title: Common Grid Model Exchange Standard
items.summary: CGMES.

items.title: Common Information Model
items.summary: CIM. A set of open standards for representing power system components

items.title: Compliance Factor
items.summary: CF.

items.title: Contingency Analysis
items.summary: Procedures to study a contingency.

items.title: Contingency List
items.summary: A list of network elements to be simulated as disconnected.

items.title: Contingency Reserve Service
items.summary: Reserve that can be satisfied in 10 minutes or less.

items.title: Contingency Reserve
items.summary: Capacity deployed by the Balancing Authority to meet the Disturbance Control Standard.

items.title: Contingency
items.summary: The unexpected failure or outage of a system component.

items.title: Control Area
items.summary: Geographical concept.

items.title: Control Performance Standard 1
items.summary: CPS1. A standard that measures impact on frequency error.

items.title: Control Performance Standard 2
items.summary: CPS2. A standard intended to limit unscheduled flows.

items.title: Converter-Driven Stability
items.summary: Converter-interfaced generation's impact on stability.

items.title: Critical Clearing Time
items.summary: CCT. The maximum permissible duration of the fault.

items.title: Critical Inertia
items.summary: Minimum level of system inertia necessary to ensure deployment of frequency responsive reserves.

items.title: Day Ahead Energy Market
items.summary: Forward markets for electricity to be supplied the following day.

items.title: Digital Twin
items.summary: A virtual representation to reflect a physical object accurately.

items.title: Distributed Energy Resources
items.summary: DER. A source of electric power that is not directly connected to a bulk power system.

items.title: Distribution Factors
items.summary: DFAX.

items.title: Distribution Provider
items.summary: Provides and operates the “wires” between the transmission system and the end-use customer.

items.title: Distribution
items.summary: The act of distributing gas or electric power to customers.

items.title: Disturbance
items.summary: Any perturbation or sudden loss of generation or interruption of load.

items.title: Dynamic Line Ratings
items.summary: A grid enhancing technology (GET) that provides real-time ratings of transmission lines based on current weather conditions.

items.title: Dynamic Operating Envelope
items.summary: DOE. Available capacity to import/export power without violating constraints.

items.title: Dynamic Regulating Reserve
items.summary: Reserve for AGC to provide normal regulating margin.

items.title: Dynamic Study Model
items.summary: Reserve for AGC to provide normal regulating margin.

items.title: Economic Dispatch
items.summary: Allocation of generating units for economical production.

items.title: Electrical Resonance
items.summary: The behavior of power systems with conventional turbine-generators and variable speed induction generators.

items.title: Emergency Rating
items.summary: A transmission facility rating that reflects operation for a specified, finite period.

items.title: Emergency
items.summary: Abnormal system condition that requires automatic or immediate manual action.

items.title: EMT Modeling Guideline
items.summary: ISO/RTO/TSO guidelines on EMT modeling.

items.title: Energy Reserve
items.summary: A generalized notion of reserves to address the issues of storage unit reserve provision.

items.title: Equal Area Criterion
items.summary: To determine the maximum permissible increase in mechanical power input for system stability.

items.title: Expected Unserved Energy
items.summary: EUE. A measure of the capability to continuously serve loads.

items.title: Extended Equal Area Criterion
items.summary: Extend EAC to multi-machine systems.

items.title: Facility Rating
items.summary: Physical limit of a facility

items.title: Fast Frequency Response
items.summary: FFR. Power in response to frequency changes during the arresting phase

items.title: Fault
items.summary: An event such as a short circuit, a broken wire, or an intermittent connection.

items.title: Financial Markets
items.summary: Trading financially settled products.

items.title: Financial Transmission Right
items.summary: FTR. Compensation contract for transmission charges due to grid congestion.

items.title: Flexibility Options
items.summary: Voluntary market products that  manage imbalances across electricity markets.

items.title: Flexibility Reserve
items.summary: Addressing variability and uncertainty on longer timescales than operating reserves and regulation service.

items.title: Flowgate
items.summary: Portion of the transmission system used to analyze power flow impact.

items.title: Frequency Containment Reserve
items.summary: The active power reserves available to contain system frequency after the occurrence of an imbalance.

items.title: Frequency Containment Reserves
items.summary: The active power reserves available to contain system frequency after the occurrence of an imbalance.

items.title: Frequency Deviation
items.summary: A change in Interconnection frequency.

items.title: Frequency Regulation
items.summary: The ability of a Balancing Authority to help maintain Scheduled Frequency.

items.title: Frequency Response Measure
items.summary: The median of all Frequency Response observations reported annually.

items.title: Frequency Response
items.summary: The ability of a system to react to a change in system frequency.

items.title: Frequency Restoration Reserves
items.summary: The active power reserves available to restore system frequency to the nominal frequency

items.title: Frequency Stability
items.summary: The ability of a power system to maintain steady frequency following a severe system upset.

items.title: Futures Market
items.summary: For contracts for future delivery of a commodity or security.

items.title: Generation Redispatch
items.summary: Generators are adjusted away (off-cost) from their normal assignments (on-cost).

items.title: Generation Shift Factor
items.summary: GSF.

items.title: Interchange
items.summary: Energy transfers that cross Balancing Authority boundaries.

items.title: Interconnection Process
items.summary: Process for connecting new generation, transmission, and load facilities to the transmission system.

items.title: Interconnection Reliability Operating Limit
items.summary: A System Operating Limit that, if violated, could lead to instability or cascading outages.

items.title: Interconnection
items.summary: A geographic area where BPS components are synchronized.

items.title: Interruptible Demand
items.summary: Customer demand that can be interrupted by control or request of the system operator.

items.title: Inverter-based Resources
items.summary: IBR. BPS-connected resources that have a power electronic interface.

items.title: Large Load
items.summary: Load facility or aggregation at a single site that can pose reliability risks to the Bulk Power System.

items.title: Line Outage Distribution Factor
items.summary: LODF.

items.title: Localtional Marginal Price
items.summary: LMP. Marginal price for energy at the location delivered or received.

items.title: Loss-of-Load Events
items.summary: LOLEV. The number of events in which some system load is not served in a given year.

items.title: Loss-of-Load Expectation
items.summary: LOLE. The number of days per year for which the available generation capacity is insufficient.

items.title: Loss-of-Load Hour
items.summary: LOLH. The number of hours per year where demand will exceed the generating capacity.

items.title: Loss-of-Load Probability
items.summary: LOLP.

items.title: Market Power
items.summary: The ability to control or affect price.

items.title: Market Structure
items.summary: The rules, mechanisms, and processes under which a market operates.

items.title: Market Unit
items.summary: The unit sets the price of next increment or decrement of energy.

items.title: Market
items.summary: A venue where participants buy and sell products or services.

items.title: Most Severe Single Contingency
items.summary: A single contingency that would result in the greatest loss of resource output.

items.title: Multi-Criteria Decision Analysis-Based Metrics
items.summary: (MCDA)-Based Metrics.

items.title: N-Situation
items.summary: No transmission system element is unavailable due to occurrence of a contingency.

items.title: Non-Spinning Reserve
items.summary: Unconnected to the system but capable of serving demand within a specified time.

items.title: Non-Storm Resilience Metric
items.summary: A metric focuses on robustness and the ability to withstand events.

items.title: Non-Synchronized Reserve
items.summary: Reserve capability within 10 minutes not electrically synchronized to the system

items.title: Operating Envelope
items.summary: Allowed power to be transferred to/from the network.

items.title: Operating Reliability
items.summary: The ability to withstand sudden disturbances while avoiding uncontrolled cascading blackouts or damage to equipment.

items.title: Operating Reserve – Spinning
items.summary: Generation synchronized to the system and fully available to serve load within the Disturbance Recovery Period.

items.title: Operating Reserve – Supplemental
items.summary: Generation or load available to serve load within the Disturbance Recovery Period.

items.title: Operating Reserve
items.summary: Capability above firm system demand required for regulation, load forecasting error, and outages.

items.title: Oscillation
items.summary: A repetitive motion that can be either undamped, positively damped, or negatively damped.

items.title: Outage Transfer Distribution Factor
items.summary: OTDF.

items.title: Participation Factors
items.summary: One definition is about dispath and another is about small-signal stability.

items.title: Performance-Based Metrics
items.summary: Quantitative approaches for assessing system resilience.

items.title: Power Transfer Distribution Factor
items.summary: PTDF.

items.title: Primary Control
items.summary: A.k.a. <u>Frequency Response</u>.

items.title: Primary Frequency Response
items.summary: PFR. Immediate proportional response to system Frequency Deviations.

items.title: Ramp
items.summary: The rate at which the interchange schedule or generator output is attained.

items.title: Real Time Energy Market
items.summary: Use dispatch run to determine the least cost solution to balance supply and demand.

items.title: Real-Time Reliability Model
items.summary: A computer representation of the power system facilities.

items.title: Region
items.summary: Bulk power system reliability regions in North America.

items.title: Regulating Reserve
items.summary: Reserve for AGC to provide normal regulating margin.

items.title: Reliability Coordinator Area
items.summary: The collection of generation, transmission, and loads within the boundaries of the Reliability Coordinator.

items.title: Reliability
items.summary: The probability of satisfactory operation of a power system over the long run.

items.title: Remedial Action Scheme
items.summary: RAS.

items.title: Replacement Reserves
items.summary: The active power reserves available to restore or support the required level of frequency restoration reserves (FRR) to be prepared for additional system imbalances, including generation reserves.

items.title: Reserve Markets
items.summary: A market-based system for the purchase and sale of the Reserves.

items.title: Reserve
items.summary: The generating capability that is “standing by” ready for service in the event that something happens on the power system.

items.title: Resilience
items.summary: The ability to withstand and reduce the magnitude and/or duration of disruptive events.

items.title: Resonance Stability
items.summary: The behavior of power systems under oscillatory energy exchange conditions.

items.title: Resource Scheduling & Commitment
items.summary: RSC. Security-constrained resource commitment.

items.title: Response Rate
items.summary: The Ramp Rate that a generating unit can achieve under normal conditions.

items.title: Ride-through
items.summary: Ability to withstand voltage or frequency disturbances and continue operating.

items.title: Rotating Blackouts
items.summary: When each set of distribution feeders is interrupted for a limited time and then rotated among individual feeders.

items.title: Rotor Angle Stability
items.summary: The ability to remain in synchronism under normal and disturbed conditions.

items.title: Secondary Control
items.summary: Balancing services deployed in the minutes time frame.

items.title: Secondary Reserve
items.summary: Reserve capability within a 10-to-30 minute interval.

items.title: Security Constraiend Economic Dispatch
items.summary: SCED.

items.title: Security Constrained Unit Commitment
items.summary: SCUC.

items.title: Security
items.summary: The degree of risk in a power system's ability to survive imminent disturbances.

items.title: Severity Risk Index
items.summary: SRI. A daily metric that indicates performance of the BES.

items.title: Small Signal Stability
items.summary: The ability to maintain synchronism when subjected to small disturbances.

items.title: Spinning Reserve
items.summary: Synchronized generation and ready to serve additional demand.

items.title: Spot Market
items.summary: For short-term contractual commitments.

items.title: Stability Limit
items.summary: The maximum power flow possible while maintaining system stability.

items.title: Stability Limits
items.summary: Stability related transmission limits.

items.title: Stability
items.summary: The ability to maintain equilibrium during normal and abnormal conditions.

items.title: Storm Resilience Metric
items.summary: Focused on the speed of system recovery during storm events.

items.title: Subregions
items.summary: Geographic concepts for emission data by EPA.

items.title: Subsynchronous Resonance
items.summary: SSR. A condition involving energy exchange at natural frequencies below the synchronous frequency.

items.title: Synchronization Process
items.summary: The process of the equipment to synchronize its terminal voltage with another voltage source.

items.title: Synchronization
items.summary: Aligning a device's terminal voltage with another voltage source.

items.title: Synchronized Reserve Service
items.summary: Can be satisfied by online resources in 10 minutes or less.

items.title: Synchronous Machine
items.summary: SM. An AC electrical machine operated with a constant electromagnetic field.

items.title: System Flexibility
items.summary: The ability to respond to system changes and uncertainties.

items.title: Tertiary Control
items.summary: Actions taken to handle current and future contingencies.

items.title: Thermal Limit Operation Criteria
items.summary: Techniques to control contingency or system violations.

items.title: Torsional Resonance
items.summary: The SSR due to torsional interactions between series compensated lines and turbine-generator mechanical shafts.

items.title: Transient Stability Assessment
items.summary: TSA. Monitor and determine transient stability of the system.

items.title: Transmission Expansion
items.summary: The addition or modification of facilities of the Transmission System.

items.title: Transmission Interconnection Procedures
items.summary: TIP.

items.title: Transmission Planning Horizon
items.summary: Transmission planning period.

items.title: Uncertainty
items.summary: Two types of uncertainty.

items.title: Unit Commitment
items.summary: To determine commitment of resources.

items.title: Vendors
items.summary: Power system software vendors

items.title: Virtual Synchronous Machine
items.summary: VSM. Equipment that includes a DC/AC converter controlled to mimic a conventional synchronous machine.

items.title: Voltage Dip
items.summary: Short-duration decreases in RMS voltage

items.title: Voltage Limits
items.summary: Voltage limits to protect against wide area voltage collapse.

items.title: Voltage Reductions
items.summary: A.k.a brownouts

items.title: Voltage Stability
items.summary: The ability of a power system to maintain steady voltages close to nominal value.

items.title: Waveform Measurement Unit
items.summary: WMU. Sensor device to record synchro-waveforms.

items.title: Wholesale Markets
items.summary: The purchase and sale from generators to resellers.

items.title: Zonal Price
items.summary: A pricing mechanism for a specific zone within a control area.

items.title: Zone
items.summary: Geographical concept.
